committees.title: Performance and Appointments Committee
committees.purpose: The Committee will recommend the appointment of the Chief Executive, Chief Finance Officer and Monitoring Officer to Council and conduct grievance and disciplinary matters in respect of the Statutory Officers. The Committee may also be responsible for appointing an Appraisal Panel to conduct the Chief Executive’s appraisal.

committees.title: Appeals Committee
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Hears appeals against officer decisions and reviews cases within the committee's delegated authority, ensuring fair and transparent decision-making.

committees.title: Audit and Governance Committee
committees.purpose: The Audit and Governance Committee is a specialised forum, which supports and monitors the governance and accountability arrangements of the Council. The areas that the Committee looks at include internal controls, risk management, and counter fraud arrangements. The Committee helps the Council to fulfil responsibilities for accountability to the local community, and meet the expectations of partners, regulators, and other stakeholders. Audit committees do not have decision making powers but do have responsibility for approving the Council’s annual statement of accounts. Audit committees do not have powers to make recommendations like scrutiny committees but may “raise issues” with Cabinet or Council.

committees.title: Standards Hearings Sub-Committee
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Supports and determines matters relating to member conduct and standards, including hearings/panels where applicable.

committees.title: Cabinet
committees.purpose: Cabinet is the Council’s main executive decision-making body. Cabinet is responsible for taking key decisions and recommending the Budget and Policy Framework to Council. The work of the Cabinet falls into three main areas: advising the Council on future policy (in consultation with the Overview and Scrutiny Committees); taking decisions, providing they are in line with existing policy and not covered by the non-executive committees; and appointing representatives on outside bodies and organisations.

committees.title: Cabinet Member for Climate Change and Digital Decision Meeting
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Cabinet Member for Economy and Council Transformation
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Cabinet Member for Environment and Regulatory Services Decision Meeting
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Cabinet Member for Finance Decision Meeting
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Cabinet Member for Health, Culture and Visitor Experience Decision Meeting
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Deputy Leader and Cabinet Member for Housing and Planning Decision Meeting
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Executive decision-making body responsible for day-to-day decisions within the Council's executive remit and making recommendations to full Council on major policies and budgets.

committees.title: Leader of the Council Decision Meeting
committees.purpose: Some Cabinet Members have delegated authority under the Council’s Constitution to take certain decisions acting as individual Cabinet Members. Such decisions will be scheduled as required and agendas and reports will be published five clear working days in advance.

committees.title: Constitution
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Maintains and oversees the Council's Constitution and associated governance arrangements, ensuring it remains current and fit for purpose.

committees.title: Council
committees.purpose: The full Council meeting is a meeting of all councillors chaired by the Chair of the Council. The principal function of full Council is to approve, adopt and change the Council’s Budgetary and Policy Framework. Council is also responsible for appointing and setting the remits of (non-executive) committees and for appointing to statutory officer roles (Chief Executive, Chief Finance Officer and Monitoring Officer). Council meetings provide an opportunity for elected members and the public to ask questions of Cabinet members and committee chairs. Council will also consider and debate motions proposed by councillors.

committees.title: Licensing Sub-Committee (Licensing Act 2003 Matters)
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Exercises the Council's licensing and related enforcement functions (and/or sub-committee hearings) within the relevant statutory framework.

committees.title: Licensing Sub-Committee (Taxis, Private Hire, and Street Trading Consent Matters)
committees.category: Licensing Sub-Committee (Private Hire, Hackney Carriage and Street Trading Consent Matters)
committees.purposeSuggested: Suggested: Exercises the Council's licensing and related enforcement functions (and/or sub-committee hearings) within the relevant statutory framework.

committees.title: Overview and Scrutiny Committee
committees.purpose: Overview and Scrutiny Committee have the power to investigate Cabinet decisions and any other matters relevant to their remit, making recommendations to the Council, Cabinet or any other Committee or Sub-Committee of the Council. Scrutiny has an important role in holding the Cabinet to account and in contributing to policy development.

committees.title: Planning and Licensing Committee
committees.purpose: Planning and Licensing Committee is responsible for all functions relating to development control aspects of Town and Country Planning, (including determination of planning applications, enforcement action, listed building consent, conservation area consent and control of advertisements) as well as all the functions of the Council under the Licensing Act 2003 and the Gambling Act 2005. The exception is functions that the aforementioned Acts require to be Council decisions.
